description: Learn how to use React, Redux, React Router, and modern JavaScript to build an app with React. Use Webpack, Babel, Jest, React Testing Library, Enzyme, and more to build a custom React development environment and build process from the ground up.
name: Building Applications with React and Redux

description: Get started with React, React Router, and Flux by building a fast, data-driven single page application.
name: Building Applications with React and Flux

description: Leverage your existing web development skills to easily build slick native iOS apps.
name: Build iOS Apps with React Native

description: Build a full-stack JavaScript web application from scratch using React with Flux/Relay on the frontend and Node/Express with GraphQL and MongoDB on the backend.
name: Building Data-driven React Applications with Relay, GraphQL, and Flux

description: Learn how to use your existing JavaScript skills to build highly-performant native apps for both iOS and Android.
name: Build Cross Platform React Native Apps with Exponent and Redux

description: Learn the React way to build rich interactive UIs using both class and function components with React Hooks, and build a game for kids with it.
name: React: Getting Started

description: Learn to build a web application with React and Flux on the frontend, Rails as your API backend server, and tools like Webpack and Bable.js for ES6.
name: React.js on Rails: Building a Full Stack Web App

description: Learn how to use .NET to program against Active Directory.
name: Active Directory Programming for Developers

description: There are so many options for styling React components. Check out this overview of popular options so you can choose a method that works well for you on your project.
name: Styling React Components

description: An introduction to React and Flux geared towards Angular 1.x developers.
name: React and Flux for Angular Developers

description: Take a deep dive into full-stack JavaScript with React.js and learn advanced concepts like the context API, HOCs, external state, performance optimization, asynchronous APIs, testing, deployment, and more.
name: Advanced React.js

description: In this course, you will learn how to scale your React application using the ready-made React-Boilerplate stack.
name: Building Scalable React Apps

description: You may know React, but do you know how to design and distribute truly reusable React components? Learn how to design, create, and publish a reusable React component library that you can share with your team, your company, or the world.
name: Creating Reusable React Components

description: Build solid React apps with a stack composed of webpack, material-ui, flux, alt, and firebase.
name: Building a Real-time App with React, Flux, Webpack, and Firebase

description: This course is the fourth in a Learning Path of seven courses that cover Microsoft's 70-410 exam. This course explores how to install domain controllers, create and manage AD users and computers, and create and manage AD groups and organizational units.
name: Windows Server 2012 R2 (70-410) Administer Active Directory

description: This course is part 1 of 5 in the Windows Server 2008 Active Directory (70-640) series. This course will show you hands-on how to administer Active Directory using Windows Server 2008.
name: Windows Server 2008 Active Directory (70-640) Part 1

description: Master the core concepts of Active Directory on Windows Server 2003, including Active Directory Installation, organizational units, and management techniques. This course covers how to install, configure, and manage Active Directory.
name: Windows Server 2003 Active Directory Fundamentals

description: Transform slow, error prone, graphical administration of Active Directory into efficient, repeatable PowerShell commands.
name: Administering Active Directory Objects with PowerShell

description: This course is about building web sites with React and ASP.NET Core. Two different technologies that work really well together. React, the JavaScript single page app framework and ASP.NET Core, the super fast, open source, standards compliant server.
name: Building a Website with React and ASP.NET Core

description: In this course, you will learn about React Native, it's core features, and why you should choose this technology for your mobile development. Explore the diverse React Native ecosystem and what it has to offer to build cross-platform native apps.
name: React Native: The Big Picture

description: Discover the slightly more complex tasks and tactics in managing and maintaining a production Active Directory atop Windows Server 2016.
name: Manage and Maintain Active Directory Domain Services in Windows Server 2016

description: Are you ready to write structured single page applications with one of the most popular JavaScript libraries around? This course uses a hands-on approach to teach you React in under 90 minutes.
name: A Practical Start with React

description: React Native is one of the most popular ways to build native mobile apps, and it allows you to leverage your existing web skill set. This course teaches you how to use React Native components, debug, consume an HTTP API, and more.
name: React Native: Getting Started

description: React Router 4 offers a new dynamic paradigm for routing in React.js applications. This course shows the strength of dynamic routing and the possibilities of changing how you write React.js code when a Route becomes a first-class React component.
name: Client Side React Router 4

description: Netflix’s front-end developer on the Playstation team shows you how to use React and Falcor.
name: Play by Play: React and Falcor with Brian Holt

description: In this Play by Play, you'll learn the fundamental steps for creating a Xamarin project for iOS and Android as well as tips to be more productive with real world examples and experiences.
name: Play by Play: Xamarin Mobile Development

description: This code-focused course explores the exciting new Ionic framework and shows how to build mobile apps using Angular and TypeScript.
name: Building Mobile Apps with Ionic, Angular, and TypeScript

description: In this course, you will see how to take advantage of mobile device hardware using new API's in ActionScript 3.0. Software required: Animate CC.
name: Animate CC Mobile App Development

description: Learn the React way to build rich interactive UIs using both class and function components with React Hooks, and build a game for kids with it.
name: React: Getting Started

description: A rapid introduction to mobile development using Xamarin.Forms, Xamarin.iOS, and Xamarin.Android.
name: Beginning Mobile Development with Xamarin

description: Xamarin.Forms is Microsoft's recommended way of building mobile, cross-platform applications. This course will teach you how to build mobile applications for the enterprise with the MVVM pattern, dependency injection, commanding, testing, and more.
name: Building an Enterprise Mobile Application with Xamarin.Forms

description: This course will walk you through developing an HTML5 mobile app in Adobe Dreamweaver using the PhoneGap framework.
name: Dreamweaver CC Mobile App Design with PhoneGap

description: Use your C# skills to build a cross-platform mobile application and a cloud-hosted back-end. You will learn how to use Xamarin and Azure together to quickly build a rich application with login, push notifications, and a lot of code reuse.
name: Building Cross-platform Mobile Apps in C# with Xamarin and Azure

description: This course will provide an introduction to ASP.NET MVC, and also drill into new features for version 4 of the framework; including web optimizations, the web api, async programming and mobile development.
name: ASP.NET MVC 4 Fundamentals

description: This code-focused course shows how to build mobile apps with the Ionic Framework and AngularJS. The Ionic Framework represents an exciting new way to quickly build professional quality mobile apps.
name: Building Mobile Apps With the Ionic Framework and AngularJS

description: Learn how to accomplish sharing and connecting data between users, integrating third party services, and persisting data on a remote server using Retrofit, one of the most popular HTTP communication libraries on Android.
name: Android: Getting Started with Retrofit

description: Leverage your existing web development skills to easily build slick native iOS apps.
name: Build iOS Apps with React Native

description: This course provides all the information you need to build Azure Mobile services and clients on any platform.
name: Microsoft Azure Mobile Services

description: This course is specifically designed for the Web Forms developer who wants to learn to build modern, responsive, web applications. You can use Bootstrap, HTML5, CSS3, and jQuery within Web Forms.
name: Building Mobile Web Sites Using Web Forms, Bootstrap, and HTML5

description: Building Cross-Platform Mobile Apps with Telerik AppBuilder (formerly called Icenium) introduces all of the major features of Telerik AppBuilder, which enables you to quickly build robust hybrid mobile applications with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
name: Building Cross-Platform Mobile Apps with Telerik AppBuilder

description: Throughout these lessons we'll learn how to design a mobile game while writing a game design document (GDD). Software required: Balsalmiq, Microsoft Word 2013, Microsoft Visio 2013.
name: Designing Mobile Games with a Game Design Document

description: Firebase has announced Cloud Firestore as its new flagship database. In this course you’ll learn how to use Firestore to manage your application data with its unique “document-oriented” design.
name: Firebase on Android: Cloud Firestore

description: The Google Play Services API provides a breadth of tools to help build out great features natively in Android Applications. This course will introduce you to the basics of implementing two of the these features: Nearby Messaging and Mobile Vision.
name: Getting Started with Google Play Services

description: This course shows you the building blocks of Xamarin, Microsoft’s solution for building mobile applications that run on any device and on any platform, and you will be able to decide whether or not it's something for you to invest in.
name: Xamarin: The Big Picture

description: In this course, you'll learn to provide attractive, insightful dashboards for your organization that can go anywhere with SSRS Mobile Reports. This course covers all charts, gauges, and maps in depth to make designing your dashboards a breeze.
name: Build and Deploy SSRS Mobile Reports

description: Your web development skills can be used to build more than web apps. This course will show you how you can use Visual Studio to create mobile applications for iOS and Android with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
name: Building Mobile Apps with Visual Studio Tools for Apache Cordova

description: This course introduces web developers to NativeScript, an open source framework for building native iOS and Android apps. Learn how a real app is constructed with NativeScript, discover its features, and alternate paths of development.
name: Building Cross Platform Native Mobile Applications with NativeScript

description: This course will teach you how to build offline-first mobile apps using HTML5, offline storage, and service workers.
name: Creating Offline-first Mobile Apps with HTML5

description: The Panic Software designer creates a visual prototype of a mobile hiking application.
name: Play by Play: Mobile UI Design with Neven Mrgan

description: Android apps and reactive programming are a great match. This course will teach you how to chain network calls, handle user input and cache data, using RxJava and MVVM architecture.
name: Reactive Programming with RxAndroid and Kotlin

description: C# Fundamentals covers all the essential topics you need for developing with the C# programming language.
name: C# Fundamentals with Visual Studio 2015

description: If you've never programmed before, and you think you'd like to learn C++, why not learn it first? This course covers what you need to start writing real applications in C++.
name: Learn How to Program with C++

description: This course covers best practices for using basic C# features, guiding you on the path from apprentice to skilled C# software developer.
name: C# Best Practices: Improving on the Basics

description: This course covers best practices for using C# collections and generics, guiding you on the path from apprentice, to skilled C# software developer.
name: C# Best Practices: Collections and Generics

description: Formerly titled "C# Fundamentals - Part 1," this course is designed to give C++ and Java developers an accelerated introduction to C# on the .NET platform. For a beginner-level introduction to C#, refer to "C# Fundamentals with C# 5.0."
name: Accelerated C# Fundamentals

description: Learn C# with no prior programming experience
name: C# From Scratch

description: This course will take you from zero to being productive with modern C++, without requiring any previous specific programming knowledge.
name: C++11 from Scratch

description: Take advantage of dynamic C# to reduce the amount of code that needs to be written, meaning more time to deliver more features to the customer. You'll learn how dynamic C# can make many programming tasks easier.
name: Dynamic C# Fundamentals

description: This course will provide you with a complete and practical tour of the C programming language and libraries.
name: The C Programming Language in Action

description: The C Programming Language course is designed to give you everything you need to become a productive C programmer.
name: C Programming Language Fundamentals

description: Sit in on some live coding sessions with Jon Skeet of StackOverflow.com fame as he shows off some of the new features of C# 6.
name: Exploring C# 6 with Jon Skeet

description: Very few C++ developers know the time and effort they could save with the algorithm header of the Standard Library. This course unlocks that header by connecting tasks you need to perform to the single line of code from the STL to do them.
name: Beautiful C++: STL Algorithms

description: This course teaches you how equality and comparisons function in .NET and the correct way to implement equality and comparisons for your own types.
name: C# Equality and Comparisons

description: A basic introduction to the Objective-C programming language and XCode IDE.
name: Introduction to Objective-C

description: This course will provide you with detailed information about all of the changes made to the language since C++98/03.
name: C++11 Language Features

description: Learn to write modern C++: expressive, readable, fast, and secure code that’s just more fun than the old way.
name: C++ Advanced Topics

description: A course about the practical application of the modern C++ language and libraries including C++11 and beyond.
name: Modern C++ Libraries

description: Use this course to teach your kids to program with C#.
name: Teaching Kids Programming with C#

description: This course gives an accelerated introduction to the C++ programming language for developers who are already familiar with another OOP language such as C# or Java.
name: Accelerated Introduction to C++

description: Short-circuit your learning of C# with more handy C# and .NET features.
name: C# Tips and Traps 2

description: Quickly become proficient in C# by leveraging your existing VB.NET skills.
name: C# for Visual Basic .NET Developers

description: Short-circuit your learning of C# with this smorgasbord of handy C# and .NET features.
name: C# Tips and Traps

description: C# is one of the world's most popular programming language, and it continues to evolve in significant ways. This course takes a first look at the newest features now available with C# 7.
name: C# 7: First Look

description: This course teaches C# developers skills to construct easy-to-use APIs that replace tedious boilerplate with concise, readable code.
name: Designing Fluent APIs in C#

description: This course takes you, step by step, through the principles and practices of object-oriented programming (OOP). The course provides you with the firm foundation in OOP that you need to progress to intermediate-level C# courses.
name: Object-Oriented Programming Fundamentals in C#

description: This course provides thorough coverage of the core Java platform, giving you the skills needed to begin developing in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) and serving as a solid foundation for all Java-based development environments.
name: Java Fundamentals: The Core Platform

description: This course provides complete coverage of the Java programming language and serves as a strong foundation for all Java-based development environments including client-based, server-side, and Android.
name: Java Fundamentals: The Java Language

description: A quick overview of most of the new features of Java 8. The course covers lambda expressions and the Stream API but also many new additions scattered all around the JDK. JavaFX and Nashorn are also quickly covered.
name: What's New in Java 8

description: This course shows the new patterns introduced in Java 8, based on lambda expressions, the functional interfaces, the Collection Framework and the Stream API.
name: From Collections to Streams in Java 8 Using Lambda Expressions

description: To build web applications in Java, you need to understand the libraries and concepts that underly the higher level frameworks, and this course helps you to do that. The course covers writing a web application in Java using Servlets, JavaServer Pages, and tag libraries.
name: Java Web Fundamentals

description: Today most programs have a concurrent element and knowledge of concurrency is vital. This course will teach you how to use the Java libraries to achieve concurrency via multithreading.
name: Java Fundamentals - Concurrency with Multithreading

description: This course functions as a technical and business overview of Java Enterprise Edition.
name: Java EE: The Big Picture

description: Learn why you would want to use collections instead of arrays and understand the power of Lists, Sets, and Maps.
name: Java Fundamentals: Collections

description: Developing web apps just got easier. In this course, you'll learn the essentials of developing web applications with Java EE 7.
name: Java EE 7 Fundamentals

description: Simply programming in an OO language does not make your program object oriented. This course teaches you how to leverage essential object-oriented principles to write solid, maintainable code, while avoiding common pitfalls.
name: Java Fundamentals: Object-oriented Design

description: This course shows advanced patterns to process data in Java 8 using lambdas, streams, spliterators, optionals, and collectors. It shows how to build your own spliterators to connect streams to non-standard data sources, and to build your own collectors.
name: Streams, Collectors, and Optionals for Data Processing in Java 8

description: Java servlets are the first step to understanding web programming using Java, and this course will show you the basics of servlet architecture and applying filters to more complex issues like debugging and deployment.
name: Java EE: Programming Servlets

description: Deliver software faster than ever. This course will teach you core Java microservices patterns including centralized configuration, asynchronous tasks, service authorization, and request tracing.
name: Java Microservices with Spring Cloud: Developing Services

description: JavaServer Faces is the Java EE standard component-based web application framework. This course will teach you how to use JSF to build a complete web application, including building the user interface and business logic.
name: Java EE: Getting Started with JavaServer Faces

description: If you want to be able to write multi-threaded Java apps, this course is for you. You'll learn about problems with concurrent programming on multicore CPU, and false sharing. You'll also be introduced to the Java Memory model and more.
name: Applying Concurrency and Multi-threading to Common Java Patterns

description: In this unscripted and unrehearsed Pluralsight play-by-play, you will delve into the basic and advanced concepts of Docker from a Java Developer's perspective, including Docker fundamentals, Docker Compose and Docker Swarm.
name: Play by Play: Docker for Java Developers with Arun Gupta and Michael Hoffman

description: Learn to incorporate some tools and concepts from functional programming into Java code, both in Java 8 and earlier versions.
name: Functional Programming With Java

description: Java Server Pages is a technology that helps software developers to create platform independent dynamic web applications rapidly. This course will teach you how to use Java Server Pages to develop web based applications in simple and easy steps.
name: Java EE: Java Server Pages

description: This course will provide you with a quick introduction to basic JavaFX features and help you build your first JavaFX Application.
name: Java SE: Building Your First JavaFX Application

description: Java applications can often suffer from memory problems such as an OutOfMemoryError. This course shows you how to fix them using freely available tools.
name: Understanding and Solving Java Memory Problems

description: A course for all the Java Developers who want to work with JDBC Programming.
name: Java Platform: Working with Databases Using JDBC

description: Learn how to map Java objects to a relational database in your Java SE and Java EE applications.
name: Java Persistence API (JPA) 2.1

description: Distributed systems and multi-core platforms are far too prevalent now to dismiss everyday concurrency. This course outlines several concurrency patterns that the Java Concurrency API simplifies, making it much easier to scale your Java application.
name: Scaling Java Applications Through Concurrency

description: Get a first look at the all-new Java module system. In this course, you'll learn about modularity concepts such as encapsulation and explicit module dependencies, as well as how to migrate your existing code to Java 9.
name: Java 9 Modularity: First Look

description: Kotlin is a lanuage that compiles to Java bytecode and runs on the JVM; it's designed to address many of Java's shortcomings. This course aims to give you an introduction to Kotlin to get you developing applications quickly.
name: Getting Started with Kotlin
